turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: The radiation is not an anomaly, it's the clue. This creature is far too unique on every level to be some lost dinosaur.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Don't tell me why it's not, tell me what the hell it is.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What do we know? It was first sighted off the French Polynesian Pacific. An area that has been exposed to dozens of nuclear tests over the last thirty years.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You know, he's not an enemy trying to evade you. He's just an animal.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: What are you suggesting?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: When I needed to catch earthworms, I knew the best way to catch them was not to chase them. I had to draw them out.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Well, yes. I did. Clearly he was injured and bled.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: You see, all we need to do is get a better shot at it with weapons that don't rely on heat seeking...

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Um, excuse me, sir, but the situation's more complicated than that. The blood I recovered revealed that the creature is either about to lay eggs or already has.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No, it reproduces asexually. That's why we must find the nest. If we don't, dozens will be born, each one capable of laying eggs of its own. Very quickly we could be looking at an enormous population.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: So after we kill the creature we'll begin a search for the nest.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It may be too late by then. These eggs will hatch very quickly.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: You gave them the tape?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No, it's still in my tent. It's...oh my God, she took it.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: We think there's a strong reason to believe it may be hiding inside one of the buildings within the sequestered area.

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: But you don't know for sure!

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: General Anderson, the problem was the terrain. If we lure him out into a more open area such as this portion of Central Park...  We should be able to take him down.

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: Last time you didn't even scratch it!

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: That's not true. Our worm guy, er, I mean, Dr. Tatopoulos found blood.

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: Do you have any idea what's going on out there? The phones are ringing off the hook with people screaming to be let back into the city.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: We're sending divers into the river now to retrieve the body.

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: That thing's dead. What the hell are we waiting for?

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Organize a search party. I want a complete sweep of the entire city and subway system.

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: You don't have the authority to do that.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Are you looking for this?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Do I know you?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: We've met before.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh yeah, the insurance guy.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: SDECE, Service de Documentation Exterieure et de Contre-Espionnage. Agent Phillip Raymond.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Sounds like a big company.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: It's the French Secret Service.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: We have learned that your American friends have decided not to look for the creature's nest.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Are you sure? How do you know?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: We know.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Why are you telling this to me?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I need you to trust me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Why do you need that?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I need your trust if you're to help me find the nest.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh, my bags. I've checked them in.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: We, have already taken care of them.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: How did you get all of this stuff into the country?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: This is America. There is nothing you can not buy.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: So why all the secrecy? Why aren't you guys working with the US military?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I am not permitted to speak of such things.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I am a patriot. I love my country. Can you understand that?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: It is my job to protect my country. Sometimes I must even protect it from itself. From mistakes we have made. Mistakes that we do not want the world to know about.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Your talking about the nuclear testing in the Pacific.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Yes. This testing done by my country left a terrible mess. We are here to clean it up.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Here. 23rd street subway station. Where we first found the fish. With a little luck, this will lead us right to it.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: So you're in?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Are you kidding? I always wanted to join the French Foreign Legion.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What's with the chewing gum?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Makes us look more American.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: They've turned off the ventilation system. They're calling him to dinner.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Let's hope we are not the hors d'oeuvres.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Three eggs. I thought there would be more.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: You were right.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I think we should leave now.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Good idea.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Contact the military and get them to send a bomber to blow up this building before these things escape.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: How do I do that?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: 555-7600. Tell them it's a code dragonfly. They should get you through.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: What'd they say?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I can't get through. I don't know what's wrong.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Who the hell are you?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It's okay. I know her.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: It's Raymond.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I just wanted to say, au revoir and thank you for your help, my friend.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Wait.  Au revoir.

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: Dr. Lazarus... I hope that I'm not breaching protocol but.. I am so very humbled to stand in your presence... I have studied your missions extensively... Though I am Thermian, I have lived my life by your philosophy, by the code of the Mak'tar.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Well good, that's very... nice.

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: By Grabthar's Hammer, Dr. Lazarus, I-

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Don't do that. I'm not kidding.

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: I'm sorry, sir, I was only-

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Just don't.

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: ...Yes sir.  Your quarters sir.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: This is it?

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: Yes sir. Marvelous, isn't it? Completely distractionless.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Where's my bed?

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: Just as on your home planet, sir. If I may say, it took me three years to master the spikes, but now I sleep with a peace I never thought possible...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Is that the bathroom?

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: Yes sir... The use of your waste facilities were strangely absent from the historical records, so we had to extrapolate purely on the basis of your anatomy.

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: Dr. Lazarus, here is your surface mapper.  I have programed it to the coordinates of a Beryllium Sphere of sufficient density.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: Good luck on your mission, Sir. By Grabthar's Hammer, by the Suns of Warvan I wish you-

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Uh uh! What did we talk about?

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: Right... Sorry, sir.

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: Sir, it's you  Thank Ipthar!

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Quellek. What are you doing in there?

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: I avoided capture using the Mak'tar stealth haze.  Where is everyone?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Come with me. I'll explain on the way.

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: Sir! The pressure.  It's normalizing.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Open.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Okay, Quellek, let's get back to the command deck and-Suddenly we hear a PISTOL BLAST and Quellek's chest turns RED. Alexander and Quellek look down at the blood, horrified.

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: I'm... I'm shot.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Not so bad. We'll get you to medical quarters. You're going to be fine.

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: I... I don't think I'm going to make it Sir...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: No, don't talk like that, son. We're going to get you fixed up.

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: ... It has been my greatest honor to serve with you.  LIving by your example these years, my life has had meaning.  I have been blessed.  Sir, I... I...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Don't speak, Quellek.

turns.speaker: QUELLEK
turns.text: You'll forgive my impertinence, sir, but even though we had never before met, always considered you as a father to me.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Come on, old friend...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Friend. You stole all my best lines.  You cut me out of episode two entirely!..

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: You WILL go out there.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: I won't and nothing you say-

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: "The show must go on."

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: ...Damn you!  Damn you!

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: I'm glad you asked... To me the most important qualities of a Galaxy Explorer are loyalty...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: ... to camera center no matter whose shot you're blocking...

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Leadership....

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: God, what an ass.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: COME IN PROTECTOR... PROTECTOR...

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Calm down everybody.   We're just here to negotiate General Sarris' surrender.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: "Just!?"

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: At ease men.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Like throwing gasoline on a fire...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: We've got to stop!

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: We stop we die. Keep holding the thruster down Tommy!

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: You don't hold a thruster down! It's for quick boosts

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Like YOU know?

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: NO!  WE'RE ALMOST THROUGH!

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: DON'T BE INSANE, STOP! FULL STOP!

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: KEEP GOING! KEEP GOING!

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: About this much.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: What's the scale?  Is that ten miles? A hundred miles?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: THIS much.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: There it is. The Beryllium sphere.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Must be some sort of mining facility.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Go ahead!

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: You go first! There's no time!

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Oh, of course, I forgot! YOU have to be the hero, don't you?... Heaven forbid anyone else get the spotlight once! Oh no, Jason Nesmith couldn't possibly-

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: What?  What?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: I heard something. A squeal.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Fred's no good, Jason. You're going to have to kill it

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: KILL IT? Well I'm open to ideas!...

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: ALEXANDER??? PLEASE? You're my advisor, advise me!

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: ... . Well  you have to figure out what it wants... What's its motivation?

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: It's a DAMN ROCK MONSTER!!! It doesn't HAVE motivation!

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: That's your problem.  You were never serious about the caraft...  "I'm a rock... I just want to be a rock... Still. Peaceful.. Tranquil.." ..."Oh, but what's this?  Something's making noise... No, not noise, no... MOVEMENT.  VIBRATIONS.  Make the vibrations stop, they go straight into me like a knife!... I must CRUSH the thing that makes the vibrations..."

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Am I crazy, or do you actually have something there?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Hundreds dead, all so you could play at being the Commander.' You've murdered us all you egomaniacal sonofabitch!

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Shut up.' Just shut up you purple skinned monstronsity,

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: "Purple skinned monstrosity...?"

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: I was staying in character.  "Egomaniacal sonofabitch?"

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Sense memory. I see you got to win the fight...

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: I had the shot...

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: ~hex!  Alex, are you oKav?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Yes. Good was done this .....

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Okay... Let's go, buddy, they can take It from here... I'mo-

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Jason, before we entered the black hole, my instruments detected strange energy surge from Sarris' shiD~ similar to...

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: No time to worry about that, Alex. Tommy, let's get this thing slowed down... Gwen, see if you can calculate the impact point. Guy, cet down to deck C and make sure tne injured are secured. Also lets-

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: He's a twit!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Oh, and did you hear he booked another fan appearance without us?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Not again...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: I played Richard III...

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Settle down, Alex...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: No. I can't go out there! I won't say that ridiculous catch phrase one more time. I won't.  I can't!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: What the hell is going on?!!?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Jason, what have you gotten us into?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: He wants to THINK!?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: No, Jason, that's a wrap!  There's nothing to think about!

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Could you possibly try  not to hit  every  single  one!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: They're drifting toward me... I think they're magnetic!...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: What's happened?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: The engines are dead. We're drifting.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: You were holding it upside down weren't you?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: You know, with the makeup and everything1 I actually thought he was smart for a second.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: You think you could do better "Laredo?"

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Hey, watch that "Laredo" shit.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: And note the sucked in gut.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: ...Sleeves rolled halfway up the biceps...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: This is ludicrous.  Why are you listening to this man?  Must I remind you that he is wearing a costume, not a uniform?...  He's no more equipped to lead us than THIS fellow.  No offense.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: You have a better plan, Alex?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: As a matter of fact, I do. Look at their eyes. They're obviously nocturnal. Come sundown they will go into the forest to hunt. So our plan is simply to wait for nightfall instead of mounting an insane assault in full daylight simply because we did it that way in episode 31.'

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: He's a miserable twit!

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: The guy is terminally selfish!

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: Oh Alex, get away from that thing...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Dear God.... How did I come to this?

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: Alex you can't -just leave.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Oh can't I? Watch me!

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Oh good, there's nothing to eat.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: Why didn't you stop at the market?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: I still haven't got this bloody thing off.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: You could order something in.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: A boy comes to the door.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: I don't know... It just wasn't like him.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Yes, poor Jason. As we speak he's probably out somewhere talking rubbish to a roomful of hangers-on. While here I sit eating Christmas cheese in Spring.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Oh my god, It's real.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: All this from watching the.. historical records?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: We heard it the first time!

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: Shit! I'm doing it! I'm repeating the damn computer!

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: May I get the check?

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: The ships are gaining...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: WE'VE HAVE TO STOP!

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: FRONT ARMOR IS GONE! JUST SLOW IT DOWN A LITTLE!

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: "Go into the cloud! ...

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: Alex? Where are you going?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: To see if there's a pub.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: Look at that... Will you LOOK at that... They look like little children...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Could they be the miners?

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Nobody was WATCHING?

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: Those blue things ate everybody here?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: It doesn't make sense... Surely they could have fortified the compound against those creatures...

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: He knocked me out the sonofabitch. Where is he?

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: Down there.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: You said "the Commander.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Back there. You said "the Commander is down there with a bunch of cannibals."

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: No I didn't.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: Yes you did.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: He always has to make the big entrance.

turns.speaker: ALEXANDER
turns.text: By Grabthar's Hammer, this is true. 159	NT. LIVING ROOM - SOMEWHERE - NIGHT	159

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: He dissed us AGAIN, Brandon!

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: He probably... Has some very important business to attend to...

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Hi Brandon.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: No time for pleasantries, Kyle. We have a level five emergency. The Commander needs us to get him to the core and shut it down before it overloads.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Oh.  Okay.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: You've got the utility systems walkthrough, right?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: I have sectors 1-28.  I think Hector has the upper levels.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: We'd better get everybody online.  And Kyle, Stop downloading porn.  Your frame rate is unacceptable.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Commander, please settle a dispute that my crew and I are having. In "The Quasar Dilemma", the Sentient had taken control of the ship's guidance systems, however-

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Excuse me guys.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Commander, as I was saying... In "The Quasar Dilemma", you used the auxiliary of deck b for Gamma override. But online blueprints indicate deck b is independent of the guidance matrix, so we were wondering where the error lies?

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: It's a television show. Okay? That's all. It's just a bunch of fake sets, and wooden props, do you understand?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Yes but, we were wondering-

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: There IS no quantum flux and there Is no auxiliary... There's no goddamn ship  Do you get it?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: ... Yes?

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: We accidently traded Vox units when we bumped into each other on Saturday.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Oh... Oh, I see. Oh.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: What's  your name, son?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Brandon.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Brandon, I remember you from the convention, right?... You had a lot of little technical observations about the ship, and I spoke sharply to you...

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Yes, I know, and I want you to know I thought about what you said... I know you meant it constructively but...

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: It's okay. Listen-

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: ... But I want you to know that I am not a complete braincase, okay? I understand completely that It's just a TV show. There is no ship, there is no Beryllium Sphere, no diagital conveyor... I mean, obviously it's all just a-

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: It's real, Brandon. All of it, It's real.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I knew it!... I KNEW it!...

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Brandon.. . The crew and I are in trouble and we need your help.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Okay, we got it.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Okay, you can go on in... I'm going to get Kyle. He knows the utility tunnel system better than anybody alive.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Okay, now left at the next turn... Past the oxygen units.  Make a right there. Then go through the antimatter vent...

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Okay...  Okay, now what.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Now make a right, you'll see a doorway that opens on the central manufacturing facility.  The bowels of the ship.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Commander, do you have a camera?  I'd die to see this in person... All they showed on T,V was a machine here, and a wall here... I don't know why they didn't show the whole thing.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: We'd never have the budget for this.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Okay, so do you see a door marked "CORE UNIT?" Should be down at the far end to your left.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Yes...?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Okay, that's where you want to be.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Brandon.. Just in case I die, there's something I have to know...

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Yes Commander?

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: What does the Omega 13 do?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Well, that's the big question, isn't it?

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: It's been the subject of an extremely heated debate on the internet for years. Many believe that is a matter collapser, a bomb capable of destroying all matter in the universe in a chain reaction lasting 13 seconds.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: But you don't?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: No,  I am of the firm belief that in reality it is not a matter killer, but a matter REARRANGER, converting all molecules to the exact state they existed thirteen seconds previous to activation thus effecting a thirteen second time jump to the past.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: How did you come to that conclusion?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: My cousin's boyfriend's sister went out with the screenwriter. His favorite movie is the Omegaman.  He's seen it 13 times...

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: BRANDON!	TIME TO GO!

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Yes Commander... All right, you're almost there. Just go through the chompers and over the pit.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Commander, you and Lt. Madison will have to go through the crushers one at a time in three second intervals. Tell me when the first crusher hits the bottom...

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Okay, now. But-

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Wait two seconds then go.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: No, wait, are you-

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Lt. Madison, GO.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: Shit! Go!

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: GO Commander.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Go. They're off again.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Up.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: What?  Up?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Berithium lava coming through. Use the handholds above you.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: I'm at the control oaneh. What do I do?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Raise the glass and push the blue button.

turns.speaker: JASON
turns.text: That's It?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Yeah. What's wrong? JASON ~~othIno. I -ust oncuont ot wou~o oc oomooooateo onan onat.

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: Structural damage at 68 percent.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: We're getting major structural damage.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: I just can't believe it. Any of it!  Look at this room!.. They designed it based on the Tuaran Pleasure ship from "historical document" thirty seven.  Oh and wait, wait, listen to this!  Computer?

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: What's the weather like outside?

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: There is no weather in space.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: I never get tired of that joke.

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: The ship is sustaining structural damage.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: Guys, we're sustaining structural damage!...

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: The enemy is matching velocity.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: The enemy is matching velocity.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: Computer, what about our engines? Why don't we have power?

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: The Beryllium Sphere has fractured under stress.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: It's fractured...

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: Negative. The Beryllium sphere will have to be replaced.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: We need another one.

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: Negative, no reserve Beryllium sphere exists onboard.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: No, we don't have an extra Beryllium sphere.

turns.speaker: COMPUTER
turns.text: Systems register functional.

turns.speaker: GWEN
turns.text: All systems are working, Commander.
